intro: Goniothalamus puncticulatus, commonly known as the punctuated evergreen. This tropical plant is native to Southeast Asia and belongs to the family Annonaceae. It is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, fragrant flowers that typically bloom in clusters. The plant's bark and leaves contain various bioactive compounds, making it of interest in traditional medicine. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
